page.title: 06Farming - General.
page.content: As a result of a fairly high rainfall coupled with often thin and poor soils, pastoral farming is virtually the only form of land use. Most farms in the area are designated as hill farms and vary in size from typically 2-400 acres to as much as 780 acres in the north east on the upland edge. A high proportion of the acreage is 'improved' pasture, and all the farms have areas of 'meadow' based on the better quality glacial soils. Whether individual farms concentrate on sheep (Herdwick, Rough Fell or cross-breds), beef cattle (mainly Angus) or dairy cattle (usually Friesian) will depend on local factors. All farms have some sheep.
